txt.en:
'Now that you are here, [placeholder], I have little need for odd and flighty dwarves! Many goodly beasts in this most northern edge of Lasgalen have been sickened with poison. I would have sworn it was spiders, yet of course it could not be, for they have all gone missing.

'I have spoken with Beornings who dwell nearby to the west, and they, it seems, have a very similar tale to tell. Will you go to them and learn what you may, while I tend to my sickened friends? Bear with you a gift of honey. It will sweeten your dealings, I think you will find.

'Once you have gathered some honey from over there, you will want to seek out Threkmóth, the Beorning elder, at Skoghús, due south of here.'
'Ah yes, as usual Threkmóth is more concerned with honey cakes than graver matters. Well met, [placeholder], we have much to do.'
While Radagast tends to the poisoned animals, some nearby Beornings are looking into the cause, which is a mystery considering all the Mirkwood spiders seem to have fled the area.
Threkmóth can be found in Skoghús, deep in the Thornholt woods.\n\nYou should introduce yourself to Threkmóth, the leader of the Beorning settlement, and deliver your gift to him.

'Now that you are here, [placeholder], I have little need for odd and flighty dwarves! Many goodly beasts in this most northern edge of Lasgalen have been sickened with poison. I would have sworn it was spiders, yet of course it could not be, for they have all gone missing.

'I have spoken your some of your kinfolk who dwell nearby to the west, and they, it seems, have a very similar tale to tell. Will you go to them and learn what you may, while I tend to my sickened friends? Bear with you a gift of honey. They should welcome you as their own, but a simple, sweet gift rarely goes amiss!

'Once you have gathered some honey from over there, you will want to seek out Threkmóth, their elder, at Skoghús, due south of here.'

#-1:[placeholder]'Is that honey I smell, #-1:{sister[f]|brother}? You must be a friend of our friend Radagast. He said he would send help. He did not say he would send a Beorning!\n\n'Now hand that honey over and go talk to Vaskorn, while I prepare the honey cakes! He has been leading the efforts to track down the stingers.'
#-1:[placeholder] 'Ah yes, as usual Threkmóth is more concerned about honey cakes than graver matters. Well met, #-1:{sister[f]|brother}, we have much to do.'

'Is that honey I smell? You must be a friend of our friend Radagast. He said he would send help.\n\n'Now hand that honey over, and go talk to Vaskorn while I prepare the honey cakes! He has been leading the efforts to track down the stingers.'

#-1:[placeholder]'Is that honey I smell, #-1:{sister[f]|brother}? You must be a friend of our friend Radagast. He said he would send help. He did not say he would send a Beorning!\n\n'Now hand that honey over and go talk to Vaskorn, while I prepare the honey cakes! He has been leading the efforts to track down the stingers.'

'Is that honey I smell? You must be a friend of our friend Radagast. He said he would send help.\n\n'Now hand that honey over, and go talk to Vaskorn while I prepare the honey cakes! He has been leading the efforts to track down the stingers.'
You should collect honey to present to the Beornings as a gift.
You should go speak with Vaskorn, who can be found in Threkmóth, deep in the Thornholt woods.
You should travel due south of Radagast, in Thornholt, to Skoghús, the Beorning camp.
